title: Mastering Econia Order Book DEX
description: Explore Econia, a high-performance on-chain central limit order book (CLOB) built on Aptos that offers advanced trading features like limit orders, order matching, and deep liquidity for serious traders.

tasks.title: Prepare for Advanced Trading
tasks.description: Add at least 0.1 APT to your wallet to begin exploring Econia's order book

tasks.title: Order Book vs AMM
tasks.description: Understanding the difference between order book and AMM models
tasks.question: How does an order book DEX like Econia differ from an AMM DEX?
options: Order books require centralized servers, AMMs are fully on-chain
AMMs use pools with fixed pricing curves, while order books match specific buy and sell orders at exact prices
Order books can only support limit orders, not market orders
AMMs are more capital efficient than order books
tasks.correctAnswer: AMMs use pools with fixed pricing curves, while order books match specific buy and sell orders at exact prices

tasks.title: CLOB Architecture
tasks.description: Learn about Central Limit Order Books
tasks.question: What is a Central Limit Order Book (CLOB) in the context of Econia?
options: A centralized server that processes trades
A matching engine that pairs buy and sell orders by price and time priority
A system that limits the size of trades
A type of liquidity pool with concentrated liquidity
tasks.correctAnswer: A matching engine that pairs buy and sell orders by price and time priority

tasks.title: Limit Orders
tasks.question: What is a limit order on Econia?
options: An order that must be filled immediately or canceled
An order to buy/sell at a specific price or better that stays on the book until filled or canceled
An order that gets executed at the end of the trading day
A restriction on how much you can trade
tasks.correctAnswer: An order to buy/sell at a specific price or better that stays on the book until filled or canceled

tasks.title: Market Orders
tasks.description: Learn about market orders on Econia
tasks.question: How does a market order work on Econia?
options: It's placed in the order book at market price
It executes immediately against existing limit orders at the best available price
It's only executed if the price is better than the market
It requires approval from market makers
tasks.correctAnswer: It executes immediately against existing limit orders at the best available price

tasks.title: Taker and Maker Fees
tasks.question: What's the difference between maker and taker fees on Econia?
options: Maker fees are always higher than taker fees
Taker fees apply when your order immediately matches with an existing order, maker fees apply when your order waits in the book
Maker fees are charged to market makers, taker fees to retail users
There's no difference, they are the same fee
tasks.correctAnswer: Taker fees apply when your order immediately matches with an existing order, maker fees apply when your order waits in the book

tasks.title: Econia Engine Advantages
tasks.question: What makes Econia's order book implementation on Aptos potentially more efficient than on other blockchains?
options: It's not on-chain, but uses a centralized component
Move's resource-oriented programming and Aptos's parallel execution engine
It executes trades in batches rather than individually
It doesn't support complex order types
tasks.correctAnswer: Move's resource-oriented programming and Aptos's parallel execution engine

tasks.title: Market Making on Econia
tasks.description: Understanding the role of market makers
tasks.question: What role do market makers play on Econia?
options: They set the rules for the platform
They maintain the technical infrastructure
They provide liquidity by placing limit orders on both sides of the order book
They inspect trades for compliance
tasks.correctAnswer: They provide liquidity by placing limit orders on both sides of the order book

tasks.title: Econia Token
tasks.question: What is a primary purpose of the Econia (ECO) token?
options: Not yet launched or announced
Required for all trades
Governance and protocol incentives
Only for fee payment
